questions.promptMd: Which is a well‑formed JTBD statement?

answers.contentMd: When incidents spike, I want automated runbooks so I can restore service quickly
answers.feedbackMd: Correct format: When [situation], I want [motivation], so I can [outcome].

answers.contentMd: We need to improve quality and speed
answers.feedbackMd: Too vague; lacks situation, motivation, outcome.

answers.contentMd: As a manager, I want dashboards

questions.promptMd: True or False: Personas should be grounded in data such as interviews and analytics, not fictional assumptions.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Use data to avoid stereotypes.

questions.promptMd: What does the ‘Feels’ quadrant in an empathy map capture?

answers.contentMd: Emotions and affective states influencing behavior

answers.feedbackMd: Not part of the empathy map.
Not the purpose of empathy mapping.

questions.promptMd: True or False: One persona is sufficient for all segments to keep messaging simple.

answers.feedbackMd: Different segments have distinct needs; tailor accordingly.
Correct. Use multiple evidence‑based personas as needed.
